meanings.definition: To process or treat (a substance) again in order to extract or reuse valuable elements.
meanings.sent1: After collecting the plastic bottles, we will reprocess them to make new containers.
meanings.sent2: The factory will reprocess the wastewater to remove harmful chemicals before releasing it into the river.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally left my sandwich in the car, and now it looks like I need to reprocess my lunch plans.
meanings.sent4: Just like a skilled chef can reprocess leftovers into a gourmet meal, we can find new uses for old materials.
meanings.sent5: The artist decided to reprocess the clay sculpture into a completely different shape, showcasing her creativity.

meanings.definition: To subject (something) to a particular process or treatment again.
meanings.sent1: The technician will reprocess the data to ensure accurate results.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reprocess the fabric before sewing it to prevent any shrinkage later.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally hit the undo button on my computer, so now I have to reprocess all my work.
meanings.sent4: Just like a photographer can reprocess an image to enhance its colors, we can refine our ideas through revisiting them.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to reprocess their essays, focusing on improving their arguments and clarity.
